thread.title: How the Unfettered Fed Flattened the Phillips Curve

author: wsjcom
title: How the Unfettered Fed Flattened the Phillips Curve
text: Inflation no longer responds to falling unemployment in the way it used to do because politicians have allowed the Federal Reserve to do its job, writes Neel Kashkari in The Wall Street Journal. “Today’s flat Phillips curve and low long-term interest rates are not mysteries,” writes the president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Minneapolis. “They are products of a bipartisan political consensus that allows the Fed to focus on achieving its inflation and employment objectives rather than short-term political goals. If Americans want to keep this economic expansion going, we all should recognize the important role Fed independence... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
